title: SPA web UI for bd (local, real-time)
description:
Build a local-first single-page web app for the `bd` (beads) CLI that lets users browse issues, change status, and edit text with real-time updates. The app talks to a local WebSocket server; the server watches `.beads/issues.jsonl` and executes `bd` commands corresponding to edits from the UI.

Scope
- Runs locally; no cloud dependencies
- SPA served from localhost; WebSocket for data
- Live updates driven by `.beads/issues.jsonl` watcher
- Editing in UI sends WS messages; server runs matching `bd` commands

Non-goals
- Multi-user concurrency beyond a single machine
- Authentication/authorization beyond localhost-only protections

Constraints
- ECMAScript modules; JSDoc types; `.ts` only for interface declarations
- Follow provided Coding and Testing Standards
- Prefer minimal dependencies; no heavy framework required
acceptance_criteria:
- User can view issues list and open an issue detail page.
- User can change issue status and edit text fields (title, description, acceptance) from the UI.
- UI changes propagate via WebSocket to a local server; server executes the corresponding `bd` command(s).
- File watcher on `.beads/issues.jsonl` pushes updates; the on-screen issue(s) update without refresh.
- Protocol documented (request/response + push events) with versioning and error model.
- Local-only server binding (127.0.0.1) with basic input validation.
- Tests cover protocol handlers and critical UI flows.
- Quickstart docs explain setup, run, and development workflow.

title: SPA web UI for bd (local app)
description:
Purpose: Build a local, single‑page web app to browse issues, change status, and edit text for the bd CLI tracker.

Scope and constraints:
- Backend: Express app in `/server` serving static files from `/app`.
- Realtime: All data exchange via WebSocket using the `ws` package.
- Live updates: Watch `.beads/issues.jsonl`; broadcast changes to the active page/clients.
- Frontend: `index.html` and ES modules in `/app` (vanilla JS, ESM, JSDoc types).
- Actions: Client editing sends WS messages; server maps them to `bd` commands.
- Testing: Use Vitest (Node + jsdom). Configure ESLint/Prettier and type checks via `tsc`.
- Standards: Follow project coding/testing standards provided by user instructions.

High‑level capabilities:
- List, filter, and sort issues.
- View issue details including dependencies.
- Update status and priority; edit title/description.
- Auto‑refresh on `.beads/issues.jsonl` changes; push‑based (no polling).
- Display ready work and basic stats.

Non‑goals (initial phase):
- Multi‑repo orchestration, auth, or remote access beyond localhost.
- Advanced visualization (graphs) beyond simple lists/trees.

WS message types (initial draft):
- `list-issues` { filters }
- `show-issue` { id }
- `update-status` { id, status }
- `edit-text` { id, field: 'title'|'description', value }
- `update-priority` { id, priority }
- `create-issue` { title, type, priority, description }
- `list-ready` {}
- `subscribe-updates` {}

bd command mapping (examples):
- list → `bd list --json [filters]`
- show → `bd show <id> --json`
- update status/priority → `bd update <id> --status ... | --priority ...`
- close → `bd close <id>`; reopen → `bd reopen <id>`
- create → `bd create "title" -t <type> -p <prio> -d "desc"`
- dependencies → `bd dep add|remove <a> <b>`; tree → `bd dep tree <id>` (optional)

Live update source:
- Observe `.beads/issues.jsonl` (JSON Lines). On change, server emits `issues-changed` with minimal payload (timestamp + touched ids if derivable, else invalidate caches).

Dev ergonomics:
- `npm run dev`: concurrently run Express+WS with watch (nodemon) and static app server.
- `npm test`: vitest unit tests.
- `npm run lint` and `npm run typecheck`.
acceptance_criteria:
- App lists issues from current bd DB and shows details.
- Status changes and text edits via UI reflect in bd DB and survive reload.
- `.beads/issues.jsonl` changes broadcast to connected clients; UI updates without manual refresh.
- All traffic uses a WebSocket; no fetch REST endpoints for data.
- Tests: At least core flows (list/show/update/edit) covered by Vitest.
- Repo contains `/server`, `/app`, and initial docs with run instructions.

title: Bootstrap Node project and tooling
description:
Initialize project scaffolding for the SPA.
- Create `package.json` with ESM (`"type":"module"`).
- Add scripts: `start`, `dev`, `test`, `typecheck`, `lint`, `format`.
- Configure ESLint (ESM), Prettier, and tsconfig for JS type-checking with JSDoc.
- Install and configure Vitest (Node + jsdom), and `@types/node` for type hints.
- Ensure `.editorconfig` exists or add basic one.
acceptance_criteria:
- Running `npm test` executes Vitest and passes a trivial test.
- `npx tsc` runs without errors on the initial codebase.
- `npx eslint --fix` and `npx prettier --write` operate on staged files.
- Project uses ESM and JSDoc typing conventions.
notes:
Scaffolded Node project with ESM and tooling.
- Files: package.json, tsconfig.json, .eslintrc.json, .prettierrc.json, .editorconfig, vitest.config.mjs, src/utils/sum.js, test/sum.test.js. Updated existing eslint.config.js to add ignores for flat config.
- Installed dev deps: vitest, typescript, @types/node, eslint, @eslint/js, eslint-plugin-jsdoc, eslint-plugin-n, eslint-plugin-import, eslint-plugin-promise, prettier, globals.
- Validations: `npm test` passes (1 test). `npx tsc --noEmit` passes. `npx eslint --fix src test` runs clean. `npx prettier --write .` formats files.
- Node engine set to ">=18.19".

title: Express server skeleton in /server
description:
Create a minimal Express server to host the SPA and prepare for WebSocket integration.
- Serve static assets from `/app`.
- Add health endpoint `GET /healthz` returning `{ ok: true }`.
- Centralize config (port/env).
- No REST data endpoints; data will be via WS only.
acceptance_criteria:
- `npm start` boots the Express server on localhost.
- `/healthz` returns `{ ok: true }`.
- `/` serves `/app/index.html`.
notes:
Implemented server skeleton per acceptance.
- Files: server/config.js, server/app.js (GET /healthz, static /app, GET /), server/index.js (bootstrap), app/index.html placeholder.
- package.json scripts updated: start/dev run server/index.js.
- Added tests (no listen) verifying app shape and index presence.
- Installed runtime dep: express; dev types: @types/express.
- Validations: tests pass, typecheck passes, lint + prettier clean.

Note: Listening sockets are restricted in this environment, so server tests avoid binding to a port.

title: Define WebSocket protocol and message schema
description:
Specify the message envelope and payload schemas exchanged between client and server.
- Envelope: `{ id, type, payload }`; server replies `{ id, ok, type, payload, error? }`.
- Types: `list-issues`, `show-issue`, `update-status`, `edit-text`, `update-priority`, `create-issue`, `list-ready`, `subscribe-updates`, `issues-changed`.
- Error handling strategy and retry policy.
- Document mapping to `bd` commands.
- Add `app/protocol.ts` (types only) or `app/protocol.js` with JSDoc typedefs.
acceptance_criteria:
- Protocol doc checked in under `/app` and referenced by server.
- Vitest unit tests assert basic encode/decode and type guards.
notes:
Added WS protocol definitions and tests.
- app/protocol.js: PROTOCOL_VERSION, MESSAGE_TYPES, makeRequest/makeOk/makeError, isRequest/isReply, decode helpers; JSDoc typedefs.
- app/protocol.md: human-readable spec and bd CLI mapping.
- app/protocol.test.js: unit tests for type guards and round-trip.
- server/protocol.js: re-export shared protocol to reference from server code.
- Validations: tests pass (8), tsc passes, lint/prettier clean.

title: WebSocket server with ws
description:
Implement a WebSocket server using the `ws` package.
- Accept client connections; implement heartbeat/ping and cleanup.
- Parse message envelope and dispatch to handlers.
- Broadcast utility for server‑initiated events.
- No data REST endpoints; WS is canonical.
acceptance_criteria:
- Multiple clients can connect concurrently.
- Unknown message types receive a structured error.
- Heartbeats keep connections alive; idle clients are pruned.
notes: Implemented WebSocket server skeleton using ws. Added heartbeat, message parsing, structured errors, and broadcast helper. Wired into server/index.js. Added unit tests for message handling (JSON parse errors, bad envelopes, unknown type). All tests and type checks pass.

title: Architecture & protocol spec
description:
Create the initial architecture plan and protocol specification for the SPA and local WebSocket server.

Deliverables
- High-level architecture diagram and component responsibilities
- WebSocket message taxonomy (request/response + push events)
- Mapping of UI actions to `bd` commands (edit text, change status, create, link)
- Error model and versioning strategy (e.g., `protocolVersion`)
- Data model for issues used on the wire

Notes
- Run `bd --help` and review outputs to ensure full coverage of CLI verbs and flags that materially affect the UI flows.
acceptance_criteria:
- Document checked into the repo under `docs/architecture.md`.
- WS messages and payload schemas defined with examples.
- List of `bd` commands and arguments used by the server is complete and justified.
- Risks and open questions captured with owners and next steps.
notes: Drafted initial architecture and protocol spec (v1). Reviewed `bd --help` and documented CLI mappings for list/show/create/update and dep add/remove. Included error model, versioning, and watcher design. See docs/architecture.md.

title: bd command runner wrapper
description:
Implement a safe wrapper around `bd` CLI for the server.
- Use `child_process.spawn` with args array; avoid shell injection.
- Provide helpers: `runBd(args: string[]): Promise<{ stdoutJson|stdout, stderr, code }>`.
- Standardize JSON parsing for `--json` outputs; map errors to WS replies.
- Surface bd path from env or auto‑detect.
acceptance_criteria:
- Wrapper executes `bd list --json` and returns parsed JSON.
- Non‑zero exit emits structured error with code and stderr snippet.
notes:
Added bd command runner wrapper with tests.
- server/bd.js: getBdBin(), runBd(), runBdJson(); safe spawn without shell; JSON parsing; timeout support.
- server/bd.test.js: mocks child_process.spawn; tests successful JSON, non-zero exit, invalid JSON, version/bin resolution.
- Validations: all tests pass (17), typecheck passes, lint/prettier clean.

title: WS handlers: list/show issues via bd
description:
Implement server WS handlers mapping to bd commands.
- `list-issues` → `bd list --json [filters]`
- `show-issue` → `bd show <id> --json`
- Validate payloads and return normalized JSON.
acceptance_criteria:
- Client receives issue arrays and detail payloads matching protocol types.
- Errors for unknown ids or bad filters are handled gracefully.
notes:
Added WS handlers for list/show via bd.
- server/ws.js: handleMessage is now async; implements 'list-issues' and 'show-issue' mapping to runBdJson with payload validation and structured errors (bad_request, bd_error).
- Tests: server/ws.handlers.test.js mocking runBdJson; covers success and error flows.
- All tests pass (21), typecheck passes, lint/prettier clean.

title: WS handlers: update/edit actions via bd
description:
Implement server WS handlers for mutations.
- `update-status` → `bd update <id> --status <status>`
- `update-priority` → `bd update <id> --priority <0..4>`
- `edit-text` → `bd update <id> --title <t>` or `--description <d>`
- Consider `close`/`reopen` convenience types mapping to respective bd commands.
acceptance_criteria:
- Status/priority/title/description changes persist in bd DB.
- Replies include updated issue payload.
notes:
Completed mutation handlers.
- server/ws.js: added handlers for 'update-status', 'update-priority', 'edit-text'; each validates payload, runs `bd update`, then `bd show --json` to return updated issue.
- Tests: server/ws.mutations.test.js covering success and validation cases.
- All tests pass (25), typecheck passes, lint/prettier clean.

title: File watcher on .beads/issues.jsonl
description:
Watch `.beads/issues.jsonl` for changes and broadcast updates.
- Debounce rapid changes; coalesce notifications.
- Attempt to detect touched ids (optional); else send `issues-changed` with timestamp.
- Integrate with WS broadcast utility.
acceptance_criteria:
- Editing issues with bd updates triggers client UI refresh without reload.
- No redundant floods under heavy write bursts (debounce works).

title: Push updates to subscribed clients
description:
Implement subscription management and targeted broadcasts.
- Track per‑connection subscriptions (e.g., current list filters or opened issue id).
- Broadcast only relevant updates when possible; fall back to full invalidate.
acceptance_criteria:
- Clients only redraw views that changed when possible.
- Multiple clients receive consistent updates.

title: Scaffold /app index.html and base styles
description:
Create `/app/index.html` and basic CSS.
- Minimal shell with two panels: list and details.
- Include `<script type="module" src="/app/main.js"></script>`.
- Set up CSS variables and base layout without frameworks.
acceptance_criteria:
- `/` renders a simple layout with placeholder areas.
- No blocking script errors in console.

title: WebSocket client and connection management
description:
Implement client WS module in `/app/ws.js`.
- Connect, exponential backoff, and auto‑reconnect.
- Request/response correlation using `id`.
- Subscribe to updates after connect.
acceptance_criteria:
- Client can recover from server restarts.
- Inbound messages are dispatched to handlers; unknown types logged.

title: Client state store and simple router
description:
Add a minimal state store and hash‑based router.
- Track filters, selection (current issue id), and derived lists.
- Render on state changes with idempotent DOM updates (no framework).
acceptance_criteria:
- Navigating between list and detail does not reload page.
- Direct links to `#/issue/UI-123` open the detail view.

title: Issues list view
description:
Implement issues list view in `/app/views/list.js`.
- Load via `list-issues` WS message; render title, id, status, priority.
- Add filter by status and search by text (client‑side for now).
acceptance_criteria:
- List renders existing issues; filter and search work.
- Selecting an issue navigates to its detail view.

title: Issue detail view
description:
Implement issue detail view in `/app/views/detail.js`.
- Show title, description, status, priority, dependencies, and links.
- Render dependency list (blocked by / blocks).
acceptance_criteria:
- Detail reflects latest data for selected id.
- Dependency lists render and link to related issues.

title: Client edit interactions: status/priority/title/description
description:
Wire up UI controls to send WS messages for edits.
- Status dropdown, priority selector, title inline edit, description textarea.
- Disable controls while pending; optimistic update with server reconcile.
acceptance_criteria:
- Edits update bd DB and reflect back in UI.
- Pending state prevents duplicate submissions; error shows toast.

title: Handle 'issues-changed' live updates on client
description:
Implement client listeners for `issues-changed`.
- If list is visible, refresh list with `list-issues`.
- If detail is visible, re‑fetch `show-issue` for current id.
- Avoid jarring scroll/reset when possible.
acceptance_criteria:
- External `bd` changes appear within the app without reload.
- UI remains stable (no flicker) during refresh.

title: Vitest setup (Node + jsdom)
description:
Install and configure Vitest.
- Add `vitest.config.ts` suitable for ESM and mixed Node/jsdom environments.
- Add example server and client tests.
- Configure coverage output.
acceptance_criteria:
- `npm test` runs Node and jsdom suites.
- Example tests pass and import ESM modules correctly.

title: Server tests: protocol, bd runner, watchers
description:
Write unit tests for server pieces.
- Protocol encode/decode and validation utilities.
- `runBd` wrapper success/error flows.
- File watcher debounce behavior (mock fs + timers).
acceptance_criteria: - Tests cover happy/path and error cases with clear assertions.

title: Client tests: list, detail and edits
description:
Write unit tests for client views and interactions.
- List view renders and filters.
- Detail view loads and renders fields.
- Edit actions dispatch WS messages and update the UI on reply.
acceptance_criteria: - Tests run in jsdom and assert DOM state before/after actions.

title: Developer README and run scripts
description:
Add README with setup and usage instructions.
- How to run the server and app locally.
- How to run tests, type checks, lint and format.
- Notes about WS‑only data flow and `.beads/issues.jsonl` watcher.
acceptance_criteria: - README includes copy‑pasteable commands and prerequisites.
